choices.A: The IP address is placed on the highest numbered member port.
choices.D: The IP address is assigned via DHCP only.
choices.C: The IP address is placed on the lowest numbered member port.
choices.B: The IP address is placed on the port-channel logical interface.

questions.question_text: When a Layer 2 EtherChannel is configured, which statement about placement of the IP address is true?

discussion.content: yes question is not ok. It must say “L3 etherchannel”
Should this not say "When a layer 3 Etherchannel..."

Which two statements about frame LLDP is true?

A. Frame has destination multicast address
B. LLDP frame is compatible with CDP v2
C. Frame has CRC
D. LLDP multicast address is 0100-0CCC-CCCC
E. Can't be used for POE negotiation

Answer:AC

LLDP Frame consist of:
Destination address (6 bytes)—Uses a multicast address of 01-80-C2-00-00-0E. 
Source address (6 bytes)—MAC address of the sending device or port. 
LLDP Ethertype (2 bytes)—Uses 88-CC. 
LLDP PDU (1500 bytes)—LLDP payload consisting of TLVs. 
FCS (4 bytes)—Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC) for error checking. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/ncs4000/software/configure/guide/configurationguide/configurationguide_chapter_0111011.html#concept_9455F455B10941BCB7AAC3FA7AEE1A1B

Which two statements about LLDP frames are true? (Choose two)
A. LLDP frame sends to multicast address.
B. LLDP frame has its own CRC.
C. LLDP frame contains unicast address within its fields.
D. LLDP frame consists of sequence of TLVs.
E. ?

 

Answer: A D

questions.question_text: Which two statements about frame LLDP is true?

discussion.content:
EtherChannel bundles can consist of up to eight physical ports of the same Ethernet
media type and speed. Some configuration restrictions exist to ensure that only similarly
configured links are bundled.
Generally, all bundled ports first must belong to the same VLAN. If used as a trunk,
bundled ports must be in trunking mode, have the same native VLAN, and pass the
same set of VLANs. Each of the ports should have the same speed and duplex settings
before being bundled. Bundled ports also must be configured with identical spanningtree
settings. (From Cisco Official Cert Guide). I think A-E are the corrects.

comments.content: This excerpt states that the duplex settings much be the same before being bundled, therefore, C and E are correct as per the Answer

discussion.content: Yes it is A en E

questions.question_text: Which two operational attributes can be checked for EtherChannel ports that are in err-disabled state?
What is the value of the TPID/tag protocol identifier of QinQ?

discussion.content: QinQ isn't not a topic on Cisco Official Guide. This question does not make sense.
Can you please describe in brief?
The second tag is assigned an ethertype of 0x88A8 (instead of the .1Q standard 0x8100) by default. (An old non-standard 802.1QinQ protocol used 0x9100.)

questions.question_text: Which two configurations cause the frames to be tagged? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Which two configurations cause the frames to be tagged? (Choose two.)
A . interface gi 0/1.116 encapsulation dot1q
B . trunk allowed vlan 116
C . interface with access and voice VLAN configured to 116
D . interface encapsulation native vlan
E . switchport mode on

choices.C: interface with access and voice VLAN configured to 116
